mchorse.mappet.api.scripts.user.entities

Interface IScriptEntity

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    IScriptEntityItem, IScriptNpc, IScriptPlayer

    public interface IScriptEntity
    Entity interface.

    This interface represents an entity, it could be a player, NPC, or any other entity. IMPORTANT: any method that marks an argument or return as of IScriptEntity type can return also IScriptPlayer if it's an actual player, or IScriptNpc if it's a Mappet NPC!

    
     function main(c)
     {
         if (c.getSubject().isPlayer())
         {
             // Do something with the player...
         }
         if (c.getSubject().isNpc())
         {
             // Do something with the NPC...
         }
         else
         {
             // Do something with the entity...
         }
     }

      Adds a patrol point to the entity var s = c.getSubject(); s.addEntityPatrol(440, 117, 640, 1, true, "particle heart ~ ~1 ~ 0.2 0.2 0.2 1") s.addEntityPatrol(444, 117, 640, 1, true, "particle angryVillager ~ ~1 ~ 0.2 0.2 0.2 1")

      boolean isEntityInRadius(IScriptEntity entity, double radius)
      Check if an entity is in a radius of another specific entity // Kills all cows within 5 blocks of the player function main(c) { var tracker = c.getSubject(); var trackedEntities = c.getServer().getEntities("@e[type=cow]"); for each (var trackedEntity in trackedEntities) { if (trackedEntity.isEntityInRadius(tracker, 5)) { trackedEntity.kill(); } } }

    • Method Detail

      • getMinecraftEntity

        Entity getMinecraftEntity()
        Get Minecraft entity instance. BEWARE: you need to know the MCP mappings in order to directly call methods on this instance! 
        
 function main(c)
 {
     //c.getSubject().getMinecraftEntity().abilities.disableDamage = true
     c.getSubject().getMinecraftEntity().field_71075_bZ.field_75102_a = true // or false
 }

      • getWorld

        IScriptWorld getWorld()
        Get entity's world. 
        
    var s = c.getSubject();
    var world = s.getWorld();

    world.setRaining(true);

      • getPosition

        ScriptVector getPosition()
        Get entity's position. 
        
    var pos = c.getSubject().getPosition();

    c.send(c.getSubject().getName() + "'s position is (" + pos.x + ", " + pos.y + ", " + pos.z + ")");

      • setPosition

        void setPosition(double x,
                 double y,
                 double z)
        Set entity's position (teleport). 
        
    c.getSubject().setPosition(800, 8, -135);

      • getDimension

        int getDimension()
        Returns the dimension of the entity. 
        
   var dimension = c.getSubject().getDimension();
   switch (dimension)
   {
       case 0: c.send("Overworld"); break;
       case 1: c.send("The End"); break;
       case -1: c.send("The Nether"); break;
       default: c.send("Unknown dimension"); break;
   }
        Returns:
        The dimension of the entity as an integer.

      • setDimension

        void setDimension(int dimension)
        Set the dimension of the entity. 
        
   c.getSubject().setDimension(1); // Teleport to The End
        Parameters:
        dimension - The dimension to teleport the entity to.

      • getMotion

        ScriptVector getMotion()
        Get entity's motion. 
        
    var motion = c.getSubject().getMotion();

    c.send(c.getSubject().getName() + "'s motion is (" + motion.x + ", " + motion.y + ", " + motion.z + ")");

      • setMotion

        void setMotion(double x,
               double y,
               double z)
        Set entity's motion. 
        
    var motion = c.getSubject().getMotion();

    if (motion.y < 0)
    {
        // Reverse the falling motion into a jumping up motion
        c.getSubject().setMotion(motion.x, -motion.y, motion.z);
    }

      • addMotion

        void addMotion(double x,
               double y,
               double z)
        Set entity's server-sided motion. (.setMotion() causes rubber banding) Adds to the current velocity of the entity. 
        
     // Throw all items in the air
     for each (var item in c.getServer().getEntities("@e[type=item]"))
     {
         item.addVelocity(0, 0.3, 0);
     }

      • getRotations

        ScriptVector getRotations()
        Get entity's rotation (x is pitch, y is yaw, and z is yaw head, if entity is living base). 
        
     var rotations = c.getSubject().getRotations();
     var pitch = rotations.x;
     var yaw = rotations.y;
     var yaw_head = rotations.z;

     c.send(c.getSubject().getName() + "'s rotations are (" + pitch + ", " + yaw + ", " + yaw_head + ")");

      • setRotations

        void setRotations(float pitch,
                  float yaw,
                  float yawHead)
        Set entity's rotation. 
        
    // Make entity look at west
    c.getSubject().setRotations(0, 0, 0);

      • getLook

        ScriptVector getLook()
        Get a vector in which direction entity looks. 
        
     var look = c.getSubject().getLook();

     c.getSubject().setMotion(look.x * 0.5, look.y * 0.5, look.z * 0.5);

      • getHp

        float getHp()
        Get health points of this entity (20 is the max default for players). 
        
    var subject = c.getSubject();

    if (subject.getHp() < 10)
    {
        subject.send("Man, you need to replenish your health!");
    }

      • setHp

        void setHp(float hp)
        Set entity's health points. Given value that is more than max HP will get limited to max HP. 
        
    // If entity's health goes below 5 hearts, restore to max
    var subject = c.getSubject();

    if (subject.getHp() < 10)
    {
        subject.setHp(subject.getMaxHp());
    }

      • getMaxHp

        float getMaxHp()
        Get maximum health points this entity can have. 
        
    var subject = c.getSubject();

    subject.send(subject.getName() + " can have up to " + subject.getMaxHp() + " HP!");

      • setMaxHp

        void setMaxHp(float hp)
        Set entity's maximum health points. 
        
    var subject = c.getSubject();
    subject.setMaxHp(100);
    subject.send(subject.getName() + " can have up to " + subject.getMaxHp() + " HP!");

      • isInWater

        boolean isInWater()
        Check whether this entity is in water. 
        
     var subject = c.getSubject();

     c.send("Is the entity in water? " + subject.isInWater());

      • isInLava

        boolean isInLava()
        Check whether this entity is in lava. 
        
     var subject = c.getSubject();

     c.send("Is the entity in lava? " + subject.isInLava());

      • isBurning

        boolean isBurning()
        Check whether this entity is on fire. 
        
    var subject = c.getSubject();

    // Extinguish the entity if it's on fire
    if (subject.isBurning())
    {
        subject.setBurning(0);
    }

      • setBurning

        void setBurning(int seconds)
        Set entity on fire for given amount of ticks. If 0 will be provided as the sole argument, then entity's fire will be extinguished. 
        
    var subject = c.getSubject();
    var ray = subject.rayTrace(32);

    if (ray.isEntity())
    {
        ray.getEntity().setBurning(2);
    }

      • isSneaking

        boolean isSneaking()
        Is this entity is sneaking. 
        
    var subject = c.getSubject();

    if (subject.isSneaking())
    {
        subject.send("You completed Simon's task!");
    }

      • isSprinting

        boolean isSprinting()
        Is this entity is sprinting. 
        
    var subject = c.getSubject();

    if (subject.isSprinting())
    {
        subject.send("This way, you'll run away way faster from zombies!");
    }

        boolean isOnGround()
        Is this entity on the ground.

        Ray trace from entity's looking direction (including any entity intersection). Check IScriptRayTrace for an example.

        IScriptRayTrace rayTraceBlock(double maxDistance)

      • getMainItem

        IScriptItemStack getMainItem()
        Get item held in main hand. 
        
    var subject = c.getSubject();
    var item = subject.getMainItem();

    // Lightning bolt admin stick idk I didn't play on servers
    if (item.getItem().getId() === "minecraft:stick")
    {
        c.executeCommand("/summon lightning_bolt ~ ~ ~");
    }

      • setMainItem

        void setMainItem(IScriptItemStack stack)
        Set item held in main hand. 
        
    // We did a little bit of trolling
    c.getSubject().setMainItem(mappet.createItem("minecraft:diamond_hoe"));

      • getOffItem

        IScriptItemStack getOffItem()
        Get item held in off hand. 
        
    var subject = c.getSubject();
    var item = subject.getOffItem();

    // Lightning bolt admin stick (but in off hand) idk I didn't play on servers
    if (item.getItem().getId() === "minecraft:stick")
    {
        c.executeCommand("/summon lightning_bolt ~ ~ ~");
    }

   c.getSubject().setHelmet(item)

      • setArmor

        default void setArmor(IScriptItemStack helmet,
                      IScriptItemStack chestplate,
                      IScriptItemStack leggings,
                      IScriptItemStack boots)
        Set the entity's whole armor set. 
        
     var players = c.getServer().getAllPlayers();

     for each (var player in players)
     {
         var helmet = mappet.createItemNBT(mappet.createCompound("{id:\"minecraft:diamond_helmet\",Count:1b,tag:{ench:[{id:0s,lvl:3s}],RepairCost:1},Damage:0s}"));
         var chestplate = mappet.createItemNBT(mappet.createCompound("{id:\"minecraft:diamond_chestplate\",Count:1b,tag:{ench:[{id:0,lvl:4}],RepairCost:1},Damage:0s}"));
         var leggings = mappet.createItemNBT(mappet.createCompound("{id:\"minecraft:diamond_leggings\",Count:1b,tag:{ench:[{id:0,lvl:4}],RepairCost:1},Damage:0s}"));
         var boots = mappet.createItemNBT(mappet.createCompound("{id:\"minecraft:diamond_boots\",Count:1b,tag:{ench:[{id:0,lvl:4}],RepairCost:1},Damage:0s}"));

         player.setArmor(helmet, chestplate, leggings, boots)
     }

      • clearArmor

        default void clearArmor()
        Clear the entity's whole armor set. 
        
   var players = c.getServer().getEntities("@e[type=player]");
   for each (var player in players){
       player.clearArmor()
   }

        void setSpeed(float speed)
        Set entity's speed.

      • getTarget

        IScriptEntity getTarget()
        Get this entity's attack target.

      • setTarget

        void setTarget(IScriptEntity entity)
        Set this entity's attack target to given entity. 
        
     // Stop the entity that you're looking at from targeting you.
     function main(c)
     {
         var s = c.getSubject();
         var ray = s.rayTrace(64);

         if (ray.isEntity())
         {
             ray.getEntity().setTarget(null)
         }
     }

      • isAIEnabled

        boolean isAIEnabled()
        Check whether entity's AI is enabled.

      • setAIEnabled

        void setAIEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Set entity's AI to be enabled or disabled (if it has it).

      • getUniqueId

        java.lang.String getUniqueId()
        Get unique ID of this entity, which can be used, if needed, in commands as a target selector. 
        
 function main(c)
 {
     var uuid = c.getSubject().getUniqueId()
     var entity = c.getServer().getEntity(uuid)

     var motion = c.getSubject().getMotion();

     entity.setMotion(motion.x, motion.y+3, motion.z)
 }

      • getEntityId

        java.lang.String getEntityId()
        Get entity's resource location ID, like minecraft:pig or minecraft:zombie.

      • getTicks

        int getTicks()
        Get how many ticks did this entity existed.

      • getCombinedLight

        int getCombinedLight()
        Get combined light value of where the entity is currently standing. In order to get torch and sky light values separately, see the example below to "unpack" the combined value. 
        
     var light = c.getPlayer().getCombinedLight();
     var skyLight = light / 65536 / 15;
     var torchLight = light % 65536 / 15;

     // Do something with skyLight and torchLight

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        Get entity name.

      • setName

        void setName(java.lang.String name)
        Set entity name.

      • setInvisible

        void setInvisible(boolean invisible)
        Set entity to invisible.

      • getFullData

        INBTCompound getFullData()
        Get entity's full (copy of its) NBT data.

      • setFullData

        void setFullData(INBTCompound data)
        Overwrite NBT data of this entity. WARNING: use it only if you know what are you doing as this method can corrupt entities.

      • getEntityData

        INBTCompound getEntityData()
        Get Forge's custom tag compound in which you can story any data you want.

        There is no setter method as you can directly work with returned NBT compound. Any changes to returned compound will be reflected upon entity's data.

      • isPlayer

        boolean isPlayer()
        Check whether this entity is a player.

      • isNpc

boolean isNpc()
        Deprecated. 
        Check whether this entity is an NPC.

      • isNPC

        boolean isNPC()
        Check whether this entity is an NPC.

      • isItem

        boolean isItem()
        Check whether this entity is an item.

      • isLivingBase

        boolean isLivingBase()
        Check whether this entity is living base.

      • isSame

        boolean isSame(IScriptEntity entity)
        Check whether this entity is same as given entity.

      • isEntityInRadius

        boolean isEntityInRadius(IScriptEntity entity,
                         double radius)
        Check if an entity is in a radius of another specific entity 
        
     // Kills all cows within 5 blocks of the player
     function main(c)
     {
         var tracker = c.getSubject();
         var trackedEntities = c.getServer().getEntities("@e[type=cow]");

         for each (var trackedEntity in trackedEntities)
         {
             if (trackedEntity.isEntityInRadius(tracker, 5))
             {
                 trackedEntity.kill();
             }
         }
     }

      • isInBlock

        default boolean isInBlock(int x,
                          int y,
                          int z)
        Check if this entity is standing in a given block. 
        
     var s = c.getSubject();

     if (s.isInBlock(0, 0, 0))
     {
         c.send(s.getName() + " is at (0, 0, 0)!");
     }

      • isInArea

        boolean isInArea(double x1,
                 double y1,
                 double z1,
                 double x2,
                 double y2,
                 double z2)
        Check if this entity is standing in a given area. 
        
     var s = c.getSubject();

     if (s.isInArea(20, 3, 100, 30, 8, 110))
     {
         c.send(s.getName() + " is within given area!");
     }

      • damage

        void damage(float health)
        Inflict some damage on this entity (use kill() to kill the entity though). 
        
 c.getSubject().damage(1); //dealt you 1 damage

      • damageAs

        void damageAs(IScriptEntity entity,
              float health)
        Damage this entity as given entity was the source of attack. 
        
 function main(c)
 {
     var player = c.getSubject();
     var result = player.rayTrace(32);

     if (result.isEntity())
     {
         result.getEntity().damageAs(player, 1);
     }
 }

      • damageWithItemsAs

        void damageWithItemsAs(IScriptPlayer player)
        Damage this entity as given player was the source of the attack with its equipment. 
        
 function main(c)
 {
     var player = c.getSubject();
     var result = player.rayTrace(32);

     if (result.isEntity())
     {
         result.getEntity().damageWithItemsAs(player);
     }
 }

      • mount

        void mount(IScriptEntity entity)
        Mount this entity to given entity. 
        
     function main(c)
     {
         var s = c.getSubject();
         var ray = s.rayTrace(64);

         if (ray.isEntity())
         {
              s.mount(ray.getEntity());
         }
     }

      • dismount

        Dismount this entity from the entity it's riding. 
        
     function main(c)
     {
          c.getSubject().dismount()
     }

     var s = c.getSubject();

      • getBoundingBox

        ScriptBox getBoundingBox()
        Returns the bounding box of this entity. 
        
    var s = c.getSubject();
    var box = s.getBoundingBox();
    c.send("The bounding box of " + s.getName() + " is " + box.minX + ", " + box.minY + ", " + box.minZ + " to " + box.maxX + ", " + box.maxY + ", " + box.maxZ);
        Returns:
        the bounding box of this entity

      • dropItem

        Drop the item an entity is holding. 
        
 var s = c.getSubject();
 var entityItem = s.dropItem(10);
 entityItem.setNoDespawn();
 entityItem.setInfinitePickupDelay();

      • dropItem

        ScriptEntityItem dropItem()
        Drop one item of what the entity is holding. 
        
 var s = c.getSubject();
 var entityItem = s.dropItem();
 entityItem.setNoDespawn();
 entityItem.setInfinitePickupDelay();

      • dropItem

        ScriptEntityItem dropItem(IScriptItemStack itemStack)
        Drop an item of the entity even if it is not holding it. Therefore, it doesn't remove the item from the entity's inventory. 
        
 var item = mappet.createItemNBT("{id:\"minecraft:stone\",Count:64b,Damage:0s}");
 var entityItem = c.getSubject().dropItem(item);
 entityItem.setNoDespawn();
 entityItem.setInfinitePickupDelay();

      • getFallDistance

        float getFallDistance()
        Get entity's fall distance.

      • setFallDistance

        void setFallDistance(float distance)
        Set entity's fall distance.

        You can use this method, by calling it with 0, to prevent fall damage when teleporting an entity which was already falling.

      • remove

        void remove()
        Remove this entity from the server without any dead effects (essentially despawn).

      • kill

        void kill()
        Kill this entity from the server by inflicting lots of damage (similar to /kill command).

      • swingArm

        default void swingArm()
        Swing entity's main hand.

      • swingArm

        void swingArm(int arm)
        Swing entity's arm.
        Parameters:
        arm - 0 is primary (main), 1 is secondary (off-hand).

      • getLeashedEntities

        java.util.List<IScriptEntity> getLeashedEntities()
        Returns leashed entities by this entity. 
        
 var leashedEntities = c.getSubject().getLeashedEntities();
 leashedEntities.forEach(function(leashedEntity){
     leashedEntity.kill();
 });
        Returns:
        leashed entities list

      • setLeashHolder

        boolean setLeashHolder(IScriptEntity leashHolder)
        Sets the leash holder of this entity. 
        
 // Leash all entities within 5 blocks of the subject
 function main(c){
     var tracker = c.getSubject();
     var trackedEntities = c.getServer().getEntities("@e[type=!player]");
     trackedEntities.forEach(function(trackedEntity){
         if (trackedEntity.isEntityInRadius(tracker, 5)){
             trackedEntity.setLeashHolder(tracker);
         }
     });
 }
        Parameters:
        leashHolder - the entity to leash this entity to
        Returns:
        whether the leash holder was set successfully

      • getLeashHolder

        IScriptEntity getLeashHolder()
        Returns the leash holder of this entity. 
        
 //in scripted item (player: on entity interaction)
 //this leashes the entity to the player if it is not already leashed
 function main(c)
 {
     var player = c.getSubject();
     var entity = c.getObject();
     if (entity.getLeashHolder()!=null) return;
     c.scheduleScript(0, function (c)
     {
         entity.setLeashHolder(player);
     });
 }
        Returns:
        the leash holder of this entity

      • clearLeashHolder

        boolean clearLeashHolder(boolean dropLead)
        Clears the leash holder of this entity. 
        
 //free all leashed entities in the world
 function main(c)
 {
     c.getServer().getEntities("@e[type=!player]").forEach(function(entity){
         entity.clearLeashHolder(true); //true to drop the lead
     });
 }
        Parameters:
        dropLead - whether to drop the lead item
        Returns:
        whether the leash holder was cleared successfully

      • applyPotion

        void applyPotion(Potion potion,
                 int duration,
                 int amplifier,
                 boolean particles)
        Apply given potion effect on the entity for given duration, with given amplifier, and optionally with particles.

        Attention: potion effects work only with living base entities, so check for isLivingBase()! You can get the potion effect using IScriptFactory.getPotion(String).

        
    var slowness = mappet.getPotion("slowness");
    var subject = c.getSubject();

    subject.applyPotion(slowness, 200, 1, false);
        Parameters:
        potion - Potion that should be applied.
        duration - Duration of the effect in ticks (20 ticks = 1 second).
        amplifier - How strong is potion effect.
        particles - Whether potion effect's particles should be emitted.

      • hasPotion

        boolean hasPotion(Potion potion)
        Check whether given potion effect is present on this entity.

        Attention: potion effects work only with living base entities, so check for isLivingBase()! You can get the potion effect using IScriptFactory.getPotion(String).

        
    var slowness = mappet.getPotion("slowness");
    var subject = c.getSubject();

    if (subject.hasPotion(slowness))
    {
        subject.send("You're kind of slow, my dude...");
    }

      • removePotion

        boolean removePotion(Potion potion)
        Remove given potion effect from this entity.

        Attention: potion effects work only with living base entities, so check for isLivingBase()! You can get the potion effect using IScriptFactory.getPotion(String).

        
    var slowness = mappet.getPotion("slowness");
    var subject = c.getSubject();

    if (subject.removePotion(slowness))
    {
        subject.send("I made you faster, no need to thank me ;)");
    }
        Returns:
        true if there was effect, and it was successfully removed, false if had no given effect present.

      • clearPotions

        void clearPotions()
        Remove all potion effects from this entity.

        Attention: potion effects work only with living base entities, so check for isLivingBase()! You can get the potion effect using IScriptFactory.getPotion(String).

        
    var subject = c.getSubject();

    subject.clearPotions();
    subject.send("You've been freed from all potion effects!");

      • getStates

        IMappetStates getStates()
        Get entity's states (if it has some, only players and NPCs have states). 
        
 function main(c)
 {
     var states = c.getSubject().getStates()
     states.add("run", 1)

     c.send("state run: 6"+states.getNumber("run"))
 }
        Returns:
        entity's states, or null if this entity doesn't have states.

      • getMorph

        AbstractMorph getMorph()
        Get entity's morph (works with player and NPCs). 
        
    // Assuming s is a player
    var s = c.getSubject();
    var morph = mappet.createMorph("{Name:\"blockbuster.alex\"}");
    var entityMorph = s.getMorph();

    if (entityMorph != null && entityMorph.equals(morph))
    {
        c.send(s.getName() + " is morphed into Alex morph!");
    }

      • setMorph

        boolean setMorph(AbstractMorph morph)
        Set entity's morph (works with player and NPCs). 
        
    var morph = mappet.createMorph("{Name:\"blockbuster.alex\"}");

    // Assuming c.getSubject() is a player or an NPC
    c.getSubject().setMorph(morph);
        Returns:
        if entity's morph was changed successfully.

      • displayMorph

        default void displayMorph(AbstractMorph morph,
                          int expiration,
                          double x,
                          double y,
                          double z)
        Display a world morph to all players that see this entity (including themselves). 
        
 function main(c)
 {
     var s = c.getSubject();
     var morph = mappet.createMorph('{Name:"item"}');

     s.displayMorph(morph, 100, 0, s.getHeight() + 0.5, 0);
 }

      • displayMorph

        default void displayMorph(AbstractMorph morph,
                          int expiration,
                          double x,
                          double y,
                          double z,
                          boolean rotate)
        Display a world morph to all players that see this entity (including themselves) with toggleable following rotation. 
        
    var s = c.getSubject();
    var morph = mappet.createMorph('{Name:"item"}');

    s.displayMorph(morph, 100, 0, s.getHeight() + 0.5, 0, true);
        Parameters:
        morph - Morph that will be displayed (if null, then it won't send anything).
        expiration - For how many ticks will this displayed morph exist on the client side.
        rotate - Whether attached world morph should replicate entity's rotation (i.e. copy head rotation).

      • displayMorph

        default void displayMorph(AbstractMorph morph,
                          int expiration,
                          double x,
                          double y,
                          double z,
                          float yaw,
                          float pitch,
                          boolean rotate)
        Display a world morph to all players that see this entity (including themselves) toggleable following rotation and rotation offsets. 
        
    var s = c.getSubject();
    var morph = mappet.createMorph('{Name:"item"}');

    s.displayMorph(morph, 100, 0, s.getHeight() + 0.5, 0, 180, 0, true);
        Parameters:
        morph - Morph that will be displayed (if null, then it won't send anything).
        expiration - For how many ticks will this displayed morph exist on the client side.
        yaw - Horizontal rotation in degrees.
        pitch - Vertical rotation in degrees.
        rotate - Whether attached world morph should replicate entity's rotation (i.e. copy head rotation).

      • displayMorph

        void displayMorph(AbstractMorph morph,
                  int expiration,
                  double x,
                  double y,
                  double z,
                  float yaw,
                  float pitch,
                  boolean rotate,
                  IScriptPlayer player)
        Display a world morph to given player that sees this entity toggleable following rotation and rotation offsets. 
        
    // Show this morph only to Notch
    var s = c.getSubject();
    var morph = mappet.createMorph('{Name:"item"}');

    s.displayMorph(morph, 100, 0, s.getHeight() + 0.5, 0, 180, 0, true, c.getServer().getPlayer("Notch"));
        Parameters:
        morph - Morph that will be displayed (if null, then it won't send anything).
        expiration - For how many ticks will this displayed morph exist on the client side.
        yaw - Horizontal rotation in degrees.
        pitch - Vertical rotation in degrees.
        rotate - Whether attached world morph should replicate entity's rotation (i.e. copy head rotation).
        player - The player that only should see the morph, or null for everyone.

      • shootBBGunProjectile

        IScriptEntity shootBBGunProjectile(java.lang.String gunPropsNBT)
        Spawn a BB gun projectile. It works only if Blockbuster mod is present.

        ProTip: To get the gun props' NBT code, configure a desired BB gun, and grab it into you main hand. Execute /item_nbt false command in the chat, paste the NBT into the script, and remove {Gun: in the beginning and a } in the end.

        
     c.getSubject().shootBBGunProjectile('{Gun:{Damage:1.0f,Projectile:{Meta:0b,Block:"minecraft:stone",Name:"block"},Gravity:0.0f}}')

    function main(c)
    {
        c.getSubject().executeCommand("/kill");
    }

      • executeScript

        void executeScript(java.lang.String scriptName)
        Execute for the entity a script with a given script name and the default function "main". 
        
    c.getSubject().executeScript("example_script.js");
        Parameters:
        scriptName - The name of the script to execute.

      • executeScript

        void executeScript(java.lang.String scriptName,
                   java.lang.String function)
        Execute for the entity a script with a given script name. 
        
    c.getSubject().executeScript("example_script.js", "custom_function");
        Parameters:
        function - The name of the function within the script to execute.

      • executeScript

        void executeScript(java.lang.String scriptName,
                   java.lang.String function,
                   java.lang.Object... args)
        Execute for the entity a script with a given script name and arguments. 
        
 c.getSubject().executeScript("example_script.js", "func_with_context", c, 1, 2, 3);
 c.getSubject().executeScript("example_script.js", "func_without_context", 1, 2, 3);

 // example_script.js
 function func_with_context(c, arg1, arg2, arg3)
 {
     c.getSubject().send("arg1: " + arg1 + ", arg2: " + arg2 + ", arg3: " + arg3);
 }

 function func_without_context(arg1, arg2, arg3)
 {
     print("arg1: " + arg1 + ", arg2: " + arg2 + ", arg3: " + arg3);
 }
        Parameters:
        scriptName - The name of the script to execute.
        function - The name of the function within the script to execute.
        args - The arguments to pass to the function.

      • moveTo

        void moveTo(java.lang.String interpolation,
            int durationTicks,
            double x,
            double y,
            double z,
            boolean disableAI)

        Moves the entity to the specified position (x, y, z) with the given interpolation type and duration. The following interpolation types are supported:

        • 7linearr
        • 7quad_inr
        • 7quad_outr
        • 7quad_inoutr
        • 7cubic_inr
        • 7cubic_outr
        • 7cubic_inoutr
        • 7exp_inr
        • 7exp_outr
        • 7exp_inoutr
        • 7back_inr
        • 7back_outr
        • 7back_inoutr
        • 7elastic_inr
        • 7elastic_outr
        • 7elastic_inoutr
        • 7bounce_inr
        • 7bounce_outr
        • 7bounce_inoutr
        • 7sine_inr
        • 7sine_outr
        • 7sine_inoutr
        • 7quart_inr
        • 7quart_outr
        • 7quart_inoutr
        • 7quint_inr
        • 7quint_outr
        
    var s = c.getSubject();
    var pos = s.getPosition();
    s.moveTo("quad_out", 30, pos.x, pos.y+2, pos.z, false);
        Parameters:
        interpolation - The interpolation type used for the movement.
        durationTicks - The duration of the movement in ticks.
        x - The target x-coordinate for the entity.
        y - The target y-coordinate for the entity.
        z - The target z-coordinate for the entity.

        void observe(IScriptEntity entity)
        Makes the entity observe the given entity. 
        
    c.getSubject().observe(null); //to stop observing
        Parameters:
        entity - The entity to observe

      • addEntityPatrol

        void addEntityPatrol(double x,
                     double y,
                     double z,
                     double speed,
                     boolean shouldCirculate,
                     java.lang.String executeCommandOnArrival)
        Adds a patrol point to the entity 
        
     var s = c.getSubject();
     s.addEntityPatrol(440, 117, 640, 1, true, "particle heart ~ ~1 ~ 0.2 0.2 0.2 1")
     s.addEntityPatrol(444, 117, 640, 1, true, "particle angryVillager ~ ~1 ~ 0.2 0.2 0.2 1")
        Parameters:
        x - x coordinate
        y - y coordinate
        z - z coordinate
        speed - speed of the entity
        shouldCirculate - should the entity patrol the points in a loop
        executeCommandOnArrival - command to execute when the entity arrives at the point

 c.getSubject().clearEntityPatrols();
